Here is the standard procedure for administering a flu vaccine:

I. Pre-Administration

* Ensure the vaccine is appropriate for the patient's age, and medical history (e.g., egg allergy)
* Review the patient's medical history and medications to identify any potential contraindications or cautions 
* Obtain informed consent from the patient or guardian/caregiver before administration 
* Verify the correct dosage and dilution of the vaccine (if applicable) 
* Ensure proper vaccine storage and handling 

II. Site Selection and Preparation

* Select a clean and intact muscle area for injection (deltoid muscle recommended) 
* Clean the chosen site with an antimicrobial agent 
* Allow the site to dry completely before proceeding
